com.restgateway.service

Class RestGateway

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.restgateway.service.RestGateway

  • @Path(value="/ftp")
public class RestGateway
extends java.lang.Object
    FTP Gateway to allow browser to operate as a FTP Client. Salomon Emmeline & Dubiez Fran√ßois. Based on: * http://localhost:8080/rest/api/helloworld * @author Lionel Seinturier

        @Path(value="/welcome")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response welcomeFtp()
        Welcome message from the FTP server to validate effectiveness of communication with the FTP server.
        Returns:
        "220 Service ready for new user on 127.0.0.1.. login using the USER command."

      • getFileList

        @Path(value="/list")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getFileList(java.lang.String path)
        LIST PART with http Get Method GetFileList return the root file list directory of the server This is the default behavior when you get file/ without any parameter
        Parameters:
        path -
        Returns:
        String containing HTML content

      • getFile

        @Path(value="/getfile/{file}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getFile(java.lang.String fname)
        Simplest File download through a request with GET Method No path given. Filename is the only parameter accepted due to limitation of a GET parameters (not suitable for path)
        Parameters:
        fname - Filename of the file to retrieve
        Returns:
        Response containing OCTET Stream

      • getFile

        @Path(value="/getfile")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getFile(java.lang.String fname,
                                     java.lang.String path)
        getFile allows user to retrieve a file through a HTTP Get request using queryparameters. Furthermore a direct access is possible with the path.
        Parameters:
        fname - Filename of the file to retrieve
        path - Path of the filename.
        Returns:
        Response containing OCTET Stream

      • deleteFile

        @Path(value="/delete")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteFile(java.lang.String path,
                                        java.lang.String file)
        Delete with GET method, pathname & filename. More suitable for Browser use.
        Parameters:
        path - pathname of the file.
